answers.answer: Dear kingersoll,I would recommend that you seek the care of an eyeMD specializing in retina.  There are excellent doctors at the University of Texas, Houston.Dr. FeldmanSandy T. Feldman, M.D., M.S.ClearView Eye and Laser Medical CenterSan Diego, California

question: I am a 52 year old female.  I had a heart attack in June 08.  I had 2 stents put in my heart. I was also diagnosed as a diabetic.  Since the heart attack I have had loss of vision.  The loss of vision is like looking through a spotted cloth.  It is not the whole field it is like parts of my bottom vision are blurry in spots.  .  It is on the bottom half of my eyes.  When I am in bright light, like outside on a sunny day my vision is very clear. My diabetes is undercontrol. I have been to doctors and they tell me it is like pieces of cotton specks.  I need to know will it get better and what is causing it.  I live in Houston Texas an eye specialists I should see?Thanks for any help you can provide.
title: eye blurriness
